intro: Prismatomeris brevipes, commonly known as the short-legged prismatomeris, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
